climbs.name: Hold the Line
climbs.fa: Mike & Linda Engle July 2017  bolted by Jeff Giese

content.description: Start in an alcove and stem up until you can pull left onto a grey slab.  Move up to gain a line of chert that leads to the summit.  Long climb with fun climbing to gain a true 5th class spire.
content.protection: 15 or 16 bolts.  Chain Anchors. 2 rappels with a single 60 meter rope utilizing the intermediate set of anchors on All Along the Watchtower - just to the right of Hold the Line.
content.location:
20 feet uphill from the rightmost route on Rock of Ages (Heart of Gold).

See the

Beta picture for relative location.

content.description:
Start on the slab to the right of the alcove (and start of Hold the Line).  Thin starting moves lead to easy romp to the first set of chain anchors.

From the chain anchors, step across a shallow gully and pull over a bulge.  Follow very featured, steeper rock to the summit.  Once on the bulge the climbing significantly improves.

Can be led in a single pitch if you take precautions for rope drag.
content.protection: About 15 bolts if combined into one pitch.  2 rappels with a single 60 meter rope to descend.
content.location:
10 feet right of Hold the Line.

See the

Beta picture for relative location.
